question_title: By how much will carbon dioxide emissions change from ground transportation globally between 2020 and 2025?
summary: The question asks for the percentage change in global ground transportation CO2 emissions from 2020 to 2025, resolved by Carbon Monitor. 2020 was a COVID-induced low point (~15% below 2019). Recovery has been strong: Carbon Monitor data shows +8.8% (2020→2021) and +2.5% (2021→2022). IEA data indicates transport emissions nearly returned to 2019 levels by 2024, with 2025 expected to be the peak year before EV-driven decline. Compounding the documented growth rates with estimated 2023-2025 growth yields a central estimate of ~+17%. Uncertainty stems from final 2025 data not yet published and potential methodological variations in Carbon Monitor's calculation.

factors.description: 2020 was COVID low point - ground transport emissions dropped ~15% from 2019 baseline
Strong 2021-2022 recovery documented by Carbon Monitor (+8.8% then +2.5% YoY)
IEA confirms transport emissions nearly returned to 2019 levels by 2024
ICCT forecasts 2025 as peak year for road transport emissions globally
Accelerating EV adoption could moderate final 2025 figure below trend extrapolation
